fields.description:
*Steps to produce*:
# Create GH board with multiple Epics.
# Add as many issues to these Epics.
# Go to the issue navigator, add the Epic Link column to the issue navigator and sort the issues base on the Epic Link.


*Actual Results*
Issues are randomly sorted whereby there is no an exact pattern to follow (nor the Epic key or link Id from the DB) 


*Expect Results*
Once the used order the issues base on the Epic Link, issues should be sorted base on the Epic Key.
fields.summary: Epic Link on the issue navigator is not sorted base on the Epic key

fields.description: Stories that stay open for long periods of time with work being logged to them can skew the accuracy of the version report when it's using Original Time Estimate as it's metric.
fields.summary: Allow Version Report to show velocity based on Remaining time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user of the Greenhopper rapid board, I'd like to be able to collapse the parent task from the view to hide all the sub tasks associated with it. Similar to how the classic board used to work I think.

Sometimes we have multiple subtasks that create too much noise on the board.
fields.summary: Collapse SubTasks on Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to see a commmitted scope list compared to completed scope or actual scope in the sprint report.

When I change scope of a previously committed to story the total scope changes from committed scope to 0. It should either stay as the committed scope and the changes should be reflected in the burndown chart or I should be able to see the update in the sprint report.
fields.summary: As a scrum master/ project manager I want to see committed scope and completed scope on my sprint report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like to have versions be optional and not appear in our plan mode (like it was while in labs). We work in a continuous deployment model and hence have no real need for this functionality (though teams do use it for their own needs) and having it show up on the left pane and worse, on the cards in plan mode is a distraction/annoyance.
fields.summary: Please make new Version functionality optional

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When closing the last subtask of a parent from the greenhopper board, a prompt is displayed asking if the user would like to 'Update Parent Issue'. If the user confirms this, the Parent is closed, even if the workflow doesn't allow a close (transition) from the current status. Greenhopper should not be allowed to override Jira workflow transitions.
fields.summary: Closing last subtask / 'Update Parent Issue' can override Jira Workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create 11 issues with the following parameter:
!1.jpg!

2. Create a GreenHopper Scrum board.

3. Set the *Query Result Limit* to *10* in GreenHopper Configuration:
!3.jpg!

4. Create a sprint and add all of the 11 issues into the sprint itself.

5. Create 2 different filters (named it as *filter a* and *filter b*)
!4.jpg!

6. Select *filter a* and it will display all the 10 results with *labels a* which is correct.

7. However, when select *filter b* it won't display the *TP-11* issue which having *labels b* which is not correct.
!5.jpg!
fields.summary: When set Query Result Limit, it will leads to wrong result of filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the Plan view of the RapidBoard, I can currently see Versions in a column. These versions are grouped by Project, so if I have two versions with the same name in two different Jira projects, both are listed.

If my development project is split into several Jira Projects that share a common versioning scheme (i.e. they share the same version _names_), I would like to have an option to fold identically-named versions into a single version on that screen. Hence, I would be able to filter all issues belonging to a single (cross-project) version by clicking on that version name, and I would be able to assign an issue to a version by dropping it onto that version name, without having to look for the right version/project combination (GH already knows to which project my issue belongs).
fields.summary: As a product owner I want to group versions by name (across projects)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would really like to be able to use any Global Rank field type as the *secondary* sort on my Kanban boards. I can see this happening in one of two ways:

# Allow JQL statements like "ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC", but require the user to specify the name of the rank field (possibly a prepopulated dropdown of the existing sorting fields in the query/filter). The problem with this approach is handling the UX for drag'n'drop reordering, which would be sensitive to the context of the primary sort.
# Create another Rank field type, or allow the current one, to default to a particular value (like 0 or the maximum integer value) instead of auto-incrementing the value each time an issue is created. This would allow the system to treat sorting statements the same - "ORDER BY Rank ASC, priority DESC" - while allowing a "default" ranking to take place until the rank value is set (by dragging and dropping a card higher on the list)
fields.summary: Allow Rank field to be used as a secondary sort parameter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently it's 'z' to cycle between normal, projector and no-nav mode. Let's separate it so 'z' toggles projector mode only (as it used to), and Ctrl+Shift+F toggles the "hide nav bar" mode.

Rationale: this is consistent with how Confluence does it, and also Google Docs.
fields.summary: Change "hide nav bar" shortcut

when we close a sprint and have created a "new" one without issues in it. then the unresolved issues are not moved in this sprint. the at top of backlog.

It will ne nice when this can be the default.

Thanks

When a mistype in the Original Estimate field is made and it is corrected(say from 9weeks to 9hours) there is still a spike in the Burndown Chart.

This feature request is open to look into the possibility of having a way to remove the initial Original Estimate value so it does not affect the Burndown Chart.

0. Use chrome ;)
1. Open rapid board (which have enough height to not fit to the window)

3. Refresh page (it happens only when page is loaded while the zoom-in is already set to 125%)
4. scroll the board

This was spotted on JDOG.

fields.description:
In certain cases I find that I have a need to view a Greenhopper Kanban board without the applied swimlanes. 

For example: a case where we use Jira to define which tasks is to be queued on the development queue for the comming week, with swimlanes based on what system the task belongs to. On this board the rightmost column is the dev-queue, and prioritizing the tasks by drag'n'drop regardless of a which system it belongs to seems impossimple on this board.

If swimlanes could be toggled on/off with a click of a button one would acheive two different views of the same board.
fields.summary: Toggle Swimlanes On / Off in Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-8469].
  {panel}

When opening a dropdown menu with a large amount of options, the menu doesn't force the page to scroll.

CoS:

# Four reports are affected: Version Report, Sprint Report, Sprint Burndown, Epic Report
# Control uses auto-complete, single select style
# No grouping of select options

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: Is the frother case-insensitive?
A: yes

Q: Does it search on spaces or any single char?
A: Spaces no. Any character yes. 

Q: What happens when an invalid string is typed in? Can we do other actions?
A: No Matches message, if you try to submit an invalid value it should revert to the previous selection

Q: What happens when you search on closed/archived sprints/versions?
A: same options show up as we had previously

Q: Can you search as an anonymous user?
A: same options show up as we had previously

Q: Is the input XSS-safe?
A: yes


Q: How long can the input be?
A: no limit, if it doesn't match then we revert to the selection

Q: Are there tests to update?
A: Epic and Version Report qunit tests are updated to reflect the changes
fields.summary: In order to be able to select report options easily, I want a better control to use

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If I have, as an example, a board with two projects and one sprint on it, and copy this board, it's not creating a second sprint in the _AO_60DB71_SPRINT_, it's using the same sprint in both boards.

The problem is, if after copy it, I want to split the projects in each board, so now I'll have one sprint for each project, one using the existing sprint and another using the new sprint (the copy).

Expected Behavior: When we "copy" something, we expect this will "copy" the whole board, not use the same data (the original data) from the other.
fields.summary: Create a copy from a board is not creating a copy of the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing a Sprint, the Epic name is displayed next to the issue summary on the backlog, however, when the Issue Detailed View is being displayed, the Epic name takes the space where the issue summary was being displayed, making it impossible to view the issue summary. It would be great if it was possible to remove the Epic name when the Issue Detailed view is open.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to remove the Epic name from the Backlog when the issue detailed view is being displayed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The red/yellow/green remaining estimate values for the current sprint are great in plan mode.

Having those values on each column in work mode would be really useful to understand the work remaining in the context of the project's workflow.

This should also support time estimation, not just story points
fields.summary: ENHANCEMENT: Display Remaining estimate values on Work Mode columns

fields.description:
Whenever we perform a search in the 'Issue Navigator' for issue type Epic, we are presented with the *'Epic Name'* column.

On the other hand, whenever we search for Story, we are presented with the *'Epic Link'* column - which displays the key of the Epic that the Story relates to.

It would be nice to be able to perform a search for issue type *Story* and get both Epic Name and Link fields as results, so that we can get a list of Stories, their related Epic's keys and their names on the same screen.
fields.summary: Get 'Epic Name' field when searching issue type Story in the issue navigator

*Usecase #2*
If you change an issue's metadata so that it no longer matches the rapidboard's *filter query*, it *completely disappears from all reports* (e.g. sprint report, burndown report)

_GOOGLE CHROME_

!rapid_chrome_2.jpg!

_MOZILLA FIREFOX_

fields.description:
If Greenhopper is enabled in an instance, but not licensed, it will still add Epic Name as required to epic issue type.

If the Epic issue type has been removed and new issues types have been made, this will cause the Epic Name to be required whatever new issue type has the same ID as the old Epic Issue. (See [GHS-6927]).

In OnDemand Greenhopper comes bundled and enabled by default, but not licensed, making this scenario possible.
fields.summary: Greenhopper requires Epic fields even if unlicensed

fields.summary: As a greenhopper administrator I'd like to configure the fields displayed on the cards in the kanban rapid board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-8401].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a non administrator user attempts to display sprints using the {{openSprints()}} JQL, they display the error as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 5.2.10
* OS X 10.7.5
* PostgreSQL 9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new sprint.
# Add issues to it.
# Delete those issues.
# Attempt to view the sprint using a user that does not have the *Administrator* [Global Permission|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions], for example:
{noformat}
project = JRA and Sprint in opensprints()
{noformat}
(i) This can be reproduced here with [https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JRA%20and%20Sprint%20in%20opensprints()]

h3. Expected Results

There is no error presented to the user.

h3. Actual Results

The user will receive the error as per the attached screenshot and below:
{quote}
Sprint with id 104 does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

{quote}

h3. Notes

Similar to GHS-7659.
fields.summary: openSprints() JQL returns error if no open sprints exist

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Board has working days Mon-Fri
# Today is Friday
# Create sample scrum board
# Version 3.0 has 2 issues, both 5 points. Mark one of them as done.
# View the Version Report.

Adding Saturday as a working day makes the prediction happen correctly.

Debugging through the code, it seems that the "estimate per day" is calculated as 0.
fields.summary: Version prediction is not shown for sample data

fields.summary: re-screenshot Version report (changes to legend)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
STR:

1.Run http://evbyminsd2236:8080/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1 (CDP workshop request)
2.Select any column containing two or more CDP requests, for example, ‘To be accepted’
3.Click any CDP link which is located on top, for example, CDP-37 => corresponding request is opened at the right-side part
4.Go to Settings->Send to Top

AR: “Issue has been re-ranked to the top of its column” while other issue is highlighted and opened at the right-side part of the screen (see '1.jpg')
ER:There should not be discrepancies between message and highlighted issue
fields.summary: Discrepancies between message shown and highlighted issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently with a large backlog and with a high issue creation rate it can become tedious and difficult to remember where I left off in my backlog.

Maybe this could be some sort of marker or indicator that I and other admins can move.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like the planning board to display in some way issues that I have not "triaged"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Re-opening an Issue after completing a Sprint adds it to Planned Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I'm planning a bunch of sprints in advance and finding it necessary to scroll too much to get to the backlog - see screenshot. For the same reason that there is a way to collapse and expand swimlanes, I want to be able to do the same with sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, in the Scrum planning board, I would like to be able to collapse and expand individual sprints as well as collapse/expand all sprints (similar to the swimlane collapse feature in the work board).

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The word archived is important. It works fine for any active version, but if the story has an archived version, then it throws a 500 internal server error when trying to drag it into a new version. 

Short term workaround is to manually edit and change the version. However, this is especially annoying when trying to mass-assign stories to a version.
fields.summary: Internal server error when dragging a story into a version if version already has an archived version

fields.description:
Can we have somewhere an indication that all version handling is on FixVersion field of JIRA? Options are:
# Tooltip when mouse hover on the 'VERSIONS' heading
# The small green popup that comes once issues are dragged into a Version.

This will avoid some basic questions from new users. Experienced users will never have this doubt.
fields.summary: Note about FixVersion
